name: Blackened Garlic Oat Milk Ramen
description: Behold, a vegan ramen so creamy it will give you food coma. Incredible vegan ramen with creamy miso oat milk broth and blackened garlic oil.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup oat milk (preferably barista oat milk)

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the Blackened Garlic Oil. Crush the garlic with your knife.
recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the Blackened Garlic Oil. Crush the garlic with your knife.

recipeInstructions.name: In a pot, cook the garlic in vegetable oil on medium-high heat until they become black. Once done, turn off the heat and let cool for a bit.
recipeInstructions.text: In a pot, cook the garlic in vegetable oil on medium-high heat until they become black. Once done, turn off the heat and let cool for a bit.

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the vegetables for the broth and toppings. Dice the onion finely.
recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables for the broth and toppings. Dice the onion finely.

recipeInstructions.name: Cut the scallion in half: slice one half into thin long strips and chop the other half roughly.
recipeInstructions.text: Cut the scallion in half: slice one half into thin long strips and chop the other half roughly.

recipeInstructions.name: Finish making the blackened garlic oil by blending it with a food processor.
recipeInstructions.text: Finish making the blackened garlic oil by blending it with a food processor.

recipeInstructions.name: Now, it's time to prepare the broth. First, heat up 1 tablespoon of the blackened garlic oil in a medium-sized pot. Sweat the yellow onion, spring onion, white pepper, and ginger powder together for 3 minutes (don't over-caramelize!).
recipeInstructions.text: Now, it's time to prepare the broth. First, heat up 1 tablespoon of the blackened garlic oil in a medium-sized pot. Sweat the yellow onion, spring onion, white pepper, and ginger powder together for 3 minutes (don't over-caramelize!).

recipeInstructions.name: After 3 minutes, add in the sesame seeds, mirin, miso paste, spicy broad bean paste (doubanjiang). Cook this for 3 more minutes.
recipeInstructions.text: After 3 minutes, add in the sesame seeds, mirin, miso paste, spicy broad bean paste (doubanjiang). Cook this for 3 more minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Finally, add the oat milk and water. Bring the broth up to a boil, and turn down the heat to simmer for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.text: Finally, add the oat milk and water. Bring the broth up to a boil, and turn down the heat to simmer for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: When 20 minutes is almost up, start cooking the noodles. Cook the noodles according to what the packet specifies. Once the broth is done, do a final tasting and adjust seasoning to taste. Assemble the ramen bowl and don't forget to drizzle that blackened garlic oil all over. Enjoy immediately.
